item.title: Report E-2023110449
item.description:
Report E-2023110449

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-13
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 13, 2023, four (4) 55-pound bags of UN3378 were damaged and released approximately ten (10) pounds of product to the pallet and trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. A HEPA-filtered drum vacuum was used to collect all freestanding product. The undamaged cargo was re-palletized for continued processing and shipping. The damaged bags were containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The contents of the vacuum and all UN3378-impacted materials were collected and containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2023110444
item.description:
Report E-2023110444

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 10, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1139 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the release and swept them in utilizing hand tools. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110154
item.description:
Report E-2023110154

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-27
  • City: SAUGET
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 27, 2023, eight (8) one-gallon jugs of UN3264 were crushed in transit and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from ES+ to remediate the impacted site. ES+ personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the UN3264-impacted impacted trailer and concrete pavement. The crew de palletized, re palletized, and shrink wrapped the freight for the customer. ES+ personnel solidified the damaged jugs of product. The damaged jugs and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023110261
item.description:
Report X-2023110261

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-26
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED FROM A PACKAGE CAR, THE DRUM FELL OUT OF ITS PACKAGING AS IT WAS GOING THROUGH THE SYSTEM, AND ARRIVED IN THE PRIMARY SEPARATE FROM ITS PACKAGING WHERE IT WAS THEN BROUGHT DOWN TO PSC. UNDECLARED HAZMAT DISCOVERED.

item.title: Report E-2023110130
item.description:
Report E-2023110130

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-25
  • City: ELGIN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver was pumping into his trailer when hose came disconnected allowing approximately 2 gallons of solvent to be released onto the containment pad. It was determined the driver failed to completely lock down the hose to the coupling. The solvent was immediately collected and returned to the tank. The solvent that had to wiped up with absorbent material was disposed of in the appropriate containers and will be transported for disposal following all required regulation.

  • Description: (2) 5-G pails of paint arrived crushed in transit releasing (.5) of a Gal. into trailer #OA6516. No known drains or waterways impacted PRO#184269465. Freight was unprotected, no dunnage used. Terminal cleaned and overpacked material.

item.title: Report E-2023110095
item.description:
Report E-2023110095

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-13
  • City: ROCK ISLAND
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a one-gallon release of regulated UN1133 "Resin Solution (Xylene)" was released at Terminal XQC. The caller stated that (1) a 55-gallon metal drum was damaged from a forklift puncture during unloading operations impacting Trailer #317-8061.The SDS was reviewed with the caller, who felt comfortable completing the clean-up with terminal-issued PPE. (1) 85-gallon poly drum containing the impacted "Oil Dri" absorbent material, punctured drum, the remaining material, and issued PPE was created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023110206
item.description:
Report X-2023110206

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-27
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THERE WAS A ORGANIC PEROXIDE/CORROSIVE HAZMAT PACKAGE LEAKING AT BAY 31. RESPONDER DISCOVERED THE BOX CONTAINED 12 PLASTIC CONTAINERS OF WHICH ONE HAD A CRACKED CAP. EACH CONTAINER WAS IN A PLASTIC BAG. ELEVEN CONTAINERS WERE NOT CONTAMINATED AND SENT BACK TO THE SHIPPER VIA SALVAGE DRUM.

item.title: Report E-2023110061
item.description:
Report E-2023110061

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-23
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 23, 2023, at 1418 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner Transportation Systems personnel in Romeoville, Illinois regarding the damage of approximately (1) 55-gallon drum containing Ethyl Methacrylate (UN2277, 3, II). Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed (1) 55-gallon drum containing Ethyl Methacrylate (UN2277, 3, II) was punctured, with NO release seen. They were able to transfer the contents of the drum into a new 65-gallon poly overpack without complication. The 65-gallon poly overpack containerized waste was staged onsite in preparation for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110053
item.description:
Report E-2023110053

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-11
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that due to a forklift puncture, approximately 3 cups of Air Con Spa-2500 FC (hazardous - UN1760) was released. The released product was contained to the dock floor at door 184. The terminal advised they had already cleaned and contained the release. The released product, damaged drum, and oil dri was placed into a 20-gallon metal drum lined with plastic and staged in OS&D. The contractor transferred the waste to a proper poly drum and left 2 85-gallon poly drums on site for the terminal. The waste that was staged was left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110030
item.description:
Report E-2023110030

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-09
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1 gallon of Spartan BLD (laundry detergent) (UN1760 - corrosive) was released from (1) 5-gallon bucket due to improper loading. The release impacted the trailer floor. The impacted pail was containerized by the contractors into 1-55 gal df and containerized all spent absorbents, PPE and wood chips into a separate 55 gal df. The impacted trailer floor was neutralized with a vinegar and water solution. The remainder of the pails were restacked. Waste was left onsite for the Terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110022
item.description:
Report E-2023110022

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-31
  • City: SALEM
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During the unloading process, a forklift puncture cause (2) 32-ounce bottles of Roto Drain Opener to release onto a pallet, other product boxes, and mostly the trailer floor. A contractor used oil dry to clean-up the spill. No storm drains, soil, or waterways were impacted.

item.title: Report X-2023101514
item.description:
Report X-2023101514

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-12
  • City: BEDFORD PARK
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER APPROACHED THE LEAKER ON THE SORT AISLE WITH FULL PPE DECISION TREE ON HAND. THERE WERE NO OUTER MARKINGS TO INDICATE WHAT IT MAY BE SO RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE UNKNOWN RESPONSE SHEET, WHICH LED TO THE CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET. ONCE THE LEAKER WAS CONTAINED, RESPONDER BROUGHT IT TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON ARRIVAL, RESPONDER OPENED THE BOX WAS ABLE TO IDENTIFY "ZAP DRAIN PIPE OPENER." SULFURIC ACID PG 11 UN1830.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE CONTAINED; SPILLAGE ABSORBED.

item.description:
Report X-2023101425

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-20
  • City: CHAMPAIGN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found on its side in trailer, leaking when door was opened. QA called to inspect and cleanup before anyone stepped into trailer. Upon inspection, package was placed upright in a lined tote and sent to QA for processing. It was then placed in a yellow salvage drum ASAP. DescribePack: One bottle had a loose cap causing half of the liquid inside to leak into trailer. Box was tipped over on side when found. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed upright in a lined tote with the cap placed back on. Was then sent to QA for further processing where it was placed in a yellow salvage drum.
